Macro Functions

Diagnostic Console Â» Macro Recording

 

With the Diagnostic Console, you can send a series of requests one after the other, record them and repeat at a later time.

The record is started with the Start macro recording command () and terminated with the Stop macro recording command ().

With the Replay last recorded macro command (), the just recorded macro will be executed again. The macro will not be stored in the configuration but overwritten by the next created new macro.

With the Store lastly recorded macro as script command () you can save a macro as a script file (file name extension CS). The script can be imported into the Automation Sequences dialog and handled like a "normal" script.

In the left window area a new folder is created with the name [Macros] that contains all created and saved macros. These macros can be executed via a double-click with the mouse. With the Delete macro command () you can delete macros you don't need anymore.

Note

The script file is generated as .NET snippet. For that reason, its execution depends on the setting for the Developer Mode. You can toggle this setting by clicking the corresponding button you find in the Automation Sequences dialog on the .NET Snippets page.
